ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Re: Really cool corpse locating tip
ygData.msgSnippet: Speaking of Bind Sight (and kinda changing the topic), I was goofing off in FM, binding to gobs and eventually I reached a point where I couldn t follow it
ygData.messageBody:
Speaking of Bind Sight (and kinda changing the topic), I was goofing
off in FM, binding to gobs and eventually I reached a point where I
couldn't follow it anymore and the bind got stuck in mid air. I know
there seems to be a max range thing but when I changed camera angles it
unstuck and continued to follow the little bugger all the way across
zone (switching camera occasionally). Even with the unsticking trick
is there still a max range you can follow something?

Ninev Rudeflute
36th and having grown a rampant death-on for Eboneyes, lives in FM
E'ci

--- Lyrnia Jongleur <Lyrnia@...> wrote:
> hehe WOW this thread is ancient ;)
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Richard Read [mailto:richard.read@...]
> > Sent: Saturday, February 26, 2000 12:49 PM
> > To: eqbards@onelist.com
> > Subject: [eqbards] Re: Really cool corpse locating tip
> >
> >
> > From: "Richard Read" <richard.read@...>
> >
> > Thats a really neat trick - I didn't know you could bind sight to
> > a corpse.
> >
> > Of course I dont have that song yet but this is one to remember.
> >
> > Thanks John
> >
> > Bruen Bladesong
> > Citizen of the Avengers Federation and bard of the 31st chorus
> > Erollisi Marr
> >
> > Message: 4
> > Date: Fri, 25 Feb 2000 16:21:28 -0500 (EST)
> > From: <kim@...>
> > Subject: Really cool corpse locating tip
> >
> > First you use Locating Lyric like you normally do. It'll
> > point you in the direction of the corpse, but more
> > importantly, it'll make the corpse your current target.
> >
> > Next you use Solidarity of Vision (L34) to bind sight to the
> > corpse. Switch to an external camera view, rotate around, and
> > usually you can tell from the surroundings exactly where the
> > corpse is. VERY useful for finding corpses in dangerous
> > sections of a dungeon, or if the corpse isn't where the person
> > thinks he died.
> >
> > --
> > John H. Kim
> > kim@...
> >
> >
> >
>
